column.name: description
column.value: A captivating mystery set in post-war Barcelona, where a young boy discovers a forgotten book that leads him into a world of intrigue and danger.

column.name: description
column.value: A dystopian classic exploring a society where genetic engineering, psychological manipulation, and hedonism have eradicated individuality and freedom.

column.name: description
column.value: F. Scott Fitzgerald's masterpiece delves into the Jazz Age of 1920s America, examining themes of wealth, love, and the American Dream.

column.name: description
column.value: Harper Lee's timeless novel tells the story of racial injustice and moral growth in the American South, through the eyes of young Scout Finch.

column.name: description
column.value: J.D. Salinger's iconic tale follows disillusioned teenager Holden Caulfield as he navigates the complexities of adolescence and society.

column.name: description
column.value: George Orwell's chilling vision of a totalitarian future, where individuality is crushed and reality is manipulated by a tyrannical government.

column.name: description
column.value: Jane Austen's beloved romance explores themes of class, marriage, and societal expectations, through the tumultuous relationship of Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy.

column.name: description
column.value: J.R.R. Tolkien's enchanting adventure follows Bilbo Baggins as he embarks on a quest to reclaim a stolen treasure guarded by the dragon Smaug.

column.name: description
column.value: Ray Bradbury's cautionary tale depicts a future society where books are banned and 'firemen' burn any that are found, exploring themes of censorship and knowledge.

column.name: description
column.value: William Golding's allegorical novel examines the descent into savagery of a group of boys stranded on a deserted island, highlighting the dark side of human nature.
